{"step_by_step_thinking": "Suxamethonium is a medication used to cause short-term paralysis as part of general anesthesia. It is a colorless, aqueous solution. The shelf life of a medication is the length of time it is considered to be safe and effective to use. The shelf life of suxamethonium is not as long as 2 or 3 years. It is also not as short as 6 months. Therefore, the shelf life of suxamethonium is 1 year.", "answer_choice": "B"}
